intro: Calamus jaboolum, commonly known as the African sago palm, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the Arecaceae family and is characterized by its tall, slender trunk and pinnate leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that develop into clusters of edible fruits. Calamus jaboolum is often cultivated for its ornamental value and has traditional uses in some cultures. Its botanical features make it an important species in both ecological and horticultural contexts.
